com.mesosphere.sdk.offer.taskdata

Class EnvConstants

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.offer.taskdata.EnvConstants

  • public class EnvConstants
extends java.lang.Object
    Environment variables to be set inside launched tasks themselves These are accessible to the tasks themselves via the container environment.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String FRAMEWORK_HOST_TASKENV
      Provides the host domain for pods within the service.
      static java.lang.String FRAMEWORK_NAME_TASKENV
      Provides the configured name of the framework/service.
      static java.lang.String FRAMEWORK_VIP_HOST_TASKENV
      Provides the host domain for VIPs within the service.
      static java.lang.String PLACEMENT_REFERENCED_REGION_ENV
      An environment variable indicating whether detection of regions should be required by base technology.
      static java.lang.String PLACEMENT_REFERENCED_ZONE_ENV
      An environment variable indicating whether detection of zones should be required by base technology.
      static java.lang.String POD_INSTANCE_INDEX_TASKENV
      Provides the Task/Pod index of the instance, starting at 0.
      static java.lang.String REGION_TASKENV
      Provides the region in which the task has been launched.
      static java.lang.String SCHEDULER_API_HOSTNAME_TASKENV
      Provides the hostname/port of the Scheduler's own API.
      static java.lang.String SCHEDULER_API_PORT_TASKENV 
      static java.lang.String TASK_NAME_TASKENV
      Provides the name of the pod/task within the service.
      static java.lang.String ZONE_TASKENV
      Provides the zone in which the task has been launched.

      • FRAMEWORK_HOST_TASKENV

        public static final java.lang.String FRAMEWORK_HOST_TASKENV
        Provides the host domain for pods within the service. Pods within the service would be accessed as subdomains under this domain. For example, . => pod hostname.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FRAMEWORK_VIP_HOST_TASKENV

        public static final java.lang.String FRAMEWORK_VIP_HOST_TASKENV
        Provides the host domain for VIPs within the service. VIPs within the service would be accessed as subdomains under this domain. For example, . => vip hostname.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCHEDULER_API_HOSTNAME_TASKENV

        public static final java.lang.String SCHEDULER_API_HOSTNAME_TASKENV
        Provides the hostname/port of the Scheduler's own API. Pods within the service may access scheduler-hosted APIs under this hostname. For example, <hostname>:<port>/v1/state/files/notavirus.exe.txt
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
